info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 4 at 7:30AM EDT until April 8 at 8:48AM EDT by NWS Louisville KY
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Louisville KY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kentucky...
Kentucky River at High Bridge Lock affecting Mercer, Garrard and Jessamine Counties.
Kentucky River at Frankfort Lock affecting Woodford, Anderson and Franklin Counties.
.Heavy rain from the past few days has caused the river to rise.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Kentucky River at High Bridge Lock.
* WHEN...From this afternoon to Tuesday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, Dix Drive begins to flood. At 30.0 feet, Large portion of Dix Drive floods. At 36.0 feet, Water enters homes along Dix Drive.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 AM EDT Friday the stage was 24.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 38.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this afternoon to 35.0 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall early Sunday morning. It will rise to 38.0 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 30.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 37.9 feet on 03/10/1994. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk.
The next statement will be issued by Saturday afternoon at 200 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO TUESDAY MORNING

area.areaDesc: Garrard, KY; Jessamine, KY; Mercer, KY
